title: Layered liquids arrange nanoparticles into useful configurations

title_detail.value: Layered liquids arrange nanoparticles into useful configurations

summary: Materials scientists have theorized a new 'oil-and-vinegar' approach to engineering self-assembling materials of unusual architectures made out of spherical nanoparticles. The resulting structures could prove useful to applications in optics, plasmonics, electronics and multi-stage catalysis.

summary_detail.value: Materials scientists have theorized a new 'oil-and-vinegar' approach to engineering self-assembling materials of unusual architectures made out of spherical nanoparticles.
